name: $resourceType
desc: Returns the FHIR type name for this instance

name: $sourceMaterialClass
desc: Returns: General high level classification of the source material specific to the origin of the material.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: General high level classification of the source material specific to the origin of the material.

name: $sourceMaterialType
desc: Returns: The type of the source material shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For vaccines, this subclause refers to the class of infectious agent.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The type of the source material shall be specified based on a controlled vocabulary. For vaccines, this subclause refers to the class of infectious agent.

name: $sourceMaterialState
desc: Returns: The state of the source material when extracted.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The state of the source material when extracted.

name: $organismId
desc: Returns: The unique identifier associated with the source material parent organism shall be specified.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The unique identifier associated with the source material parent organism shall be specified.

name: $organismName
desc: Returns: The organism accepted Scientific name shall be provided based on the organism taxonomy.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The organism accepted Scientific name shall be provided based on the organism taxonomy.

name: $parentSubstanceId
desc: Returns: The parent of the herbal drug Ginkgo biloba, Leaf is the substance ID of the substance (fresh) of Ginkgo biloba L. or Ginkgo biloba L. (Whole plant).

name: $addparentSubstanceId
desc: The parent of the herbal drug Ginkgo biloba, Leaf is the substance ID of the substance (fresh) of Ginkgo biloba L. or Ginkgo biloba L. (Whole plant).

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The parent of the herbal drug Ginkgo biloba, Leaf is the substance ID of the substance (fresh) of Ginkgo biloba L. or Ginkgo biloba L. (Whole plant).

name: $parentSubstanceName
desc: Returns: The parent substance of the Herbal Drug, or Herbal preparation.

name: $addparentSubstanceName
desc: The parent substance of the Herbal Drug, or Herbal preparation.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The parent substance of the Herbal Drug, or Herbal preparation.

name: $countryOfOrigin
desc: Returns: The country where the plant material is harvested or the countries where the plasma is sourced from as laid down in accordance with the Plasma Master File. For “Plasma-derived substances” the attribute country of origin provides information about the countries used for the manufacturing of the Cryopoor plama or Crioprecipitate.

name: $addcountryOfOrigin
desc: The country where the plant material is harvested or the countries where the plasma is sourced from as laid down in accordance with the Plasma Master File. For “Plasma-derived substances” the attribute country of origin provides information about the countries used for the manufacturing of the Cryopoor plama or Crioprecipitate.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: The country where the plant material is harvested or the countries where the plasma is sourced from as laid down in accordance with the Plasma Master File. For “Plasma-derived substances” the attribute country of origin provides information about the coun

name: $geographicalLocation
desc: Returns: The place/region where the plant is harvested or the places/regions where the animal source material has its habitat.

name: $addgeographicalLocation
desc: The place/region where the plant is harvested or the places/regions where the animal source material has its habitat.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The place/region where the plant is harvested or the places/regions where the animal source material has its habitat.

name: $developmentStage
desc: Returns: Stage of life for animals, plants, insects and microorganisms. This information shall be provided only when the substance is significantly different in these stages (e.g. foetal bovine serum).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: Stage of life for animals, plants, insects and microorganisms. This information shall be provided only when the substance is significantly different in these stages (e.g. foetal bovine serum).

name: $fractionDescription
desc: Returns: Many complex materials are fractions of parts of plants, animals, or minerals. Fraction elements are often necessary to define both Substances and Specified Group 1 Substances. For substances derived from Plants, fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level ( . Oils, Juices and Exudates). Additional information for Extracts, such as extraction solvent composition, will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. For plasma-derived products fraction information will be captured at the Substance and the Specified Substance Group 1 levels.

name: $addfractionDescription
desc: Many complex materials are fractions of parts of plants, animals, or minerals. Fraction elements are often necessary to define both Substances and Specified Group 1 Substances. For substances derived from Plants, fraction information will be captured at the Substance information level ( . Oils, Juices and Exudates). Additional information for Extracts, such as extraction solvent composition, will be captured at the Specified Substance Group 1 information level. For plasma-derived products fraction information will be captured at the Substance and the Specified Substance Group 1 levels.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: Many complex materials are fractions of parts of plants, animals, or minerals. Fraction elements are often necessary to define both Substances and Specified Group 1 Substances. For substances derived from Plants, fraction information will be captured at t

name: $organism
desc: Returns: This subclause describes the organism which the substance is derived from. For vaccines, the parent organism shall be specified based on these subclause elements. As an example, full taxonomy will be described for the Substance Name: ., Leaf.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: This subclause describes the organism which the substance is derived from. For vaccines, the parent organism shall be specified based on these subclause elements. As an example, full taxonomy will be described for the Substance Name: ., Leaf.

name: $partDescription
desc: Returns: To do.

name: $addpartDescription
desc: To do.
